tasks: Asymptotic behavior of solutions of a time-space fractional Volterra equation
results: Positive and boundedness of the solution
Asymptotic stability of the positive equilibrium
title: Asymptotic Behavior of Solutions of a Time-Space Fractional Diffusive Volterra Equation.pdf
abstract: . In this paper, we study the time-space fractional diﬀerential equa- tion of the Volterra type: Dα 0|t(u) + (−∆N)σu = u(1 + au −bu2) −au Z t 0 K(t −s)u(·) ds, where a, b > 0 are given constants, α, σ ∈(0, 1), equipped with a homogeneous Neumann’s boundary condition and a positive initial data. The boundedness and uniform continuity of the solution on the entire R+ are established. More- over, the asymptotic behavior of the positive solution is investigated. Keywords: time–space fractional diﬀerential equation; asymptotic behavior MSC Classiﬁcation (2020): 26A33, 35B09, 35B40, 34K37, 35R09, 35R11. 1. Introduction In this paper, we are interested to study the time asymptotic behavior of the bounded solution of the following problem Dα 0|t(u) + (−∆N)σu = u(1 + au −bu2) −auK ∗u, (1) u(x, 0) = u0(x), (2) posed on Q = Ω× (0, T) where Ω⊂Rd (where d = 1, 2 in practice) is a bounded domain with smooth boundary ∂Ωwith outward normal η; the asterisk (∗) denotes the time convolution, i.e K ∗u(x, t) = Z t 0 K(t −s)u(·, s)ds; the constants a and b in the problem are assumed to be positive and K is the delay kernel function satisfying K ≥0, K ∈C1(0, ∞) ∩L1(0, ∞), Z ∞ 0 K(t)dt = 1. The derivative operator Dα 0|t is the Caputo fractional derivative of order 0 ≤α ≤1, the operator (−∆N)σ, 0 < σ < 1, is the fractional power of the classical Laplacian operator with its speciﬁed domain and u0(x) ≥0 is a given bounded function. Equation (1) describes the evolution of a single species population whose density is u at time t in the bounded domain Ω. As in the existing model with classical 1
